attributes.action: Absentee non paying parents pay £20 fee and 4% collection fee charge!
attributes.additional_details:
With the CSA winding down and cases being handed over to government run child maintenance scheme to be run by child maintenance service.  This service offers pretty much the same as the CSA but charges the applicant £20 to apply and if absent parent does not pay will then have to pay 4% of each payment that is collected for child support.

I think the absent parent should have to pay the £20 once claim is awarded and if they do not pay they should be charged an additional  4%, not take it from child it is intended to support!   You can see charges and additional information at www.cmoptions.org
attributes.background:
Applicant to pay £20 fee and collection charges, NOT the parent that's not paying? 
I cannot be the only person in UK that thinks this is morally wrong, unfair and punishing the parent who is raising child when the parent who needs to be legally enforced to do right thing doesn't pay fees.
